settings_sections.title: Connect with Salesforce
settings_sections.description:
Please begin by authenticating this connector with Salesforce. To authorize the connector go to Overview tab and click "Credentials" button.

Please note that you connect to your Production Environment by default. If you want to connect to a Sandbox Environment, please scroll down to "Advanced" section. Connector needs to be authorized succesfully to finish the rest of the setup.

settings_sections.title: Users - Fetching Leads from Salesforce
settings_sections.description: Hull gives it's customers the ability to capture a subset of Leads fields in order to have fine grain control over the dataflow. Please configure the fields that you would like to be pulled from Salesforce below. See connector documentation (Docs tab above) for attributes mapping best practices.

settings_sections.title: Users - Sending Leads to Salesforce
settings_sections.description:
Configuring this section will result in automated data flows which will create and update your Leads in Salesforce. That's why we provide fine grain control over the updates that you send to Salesforce. By default no users are sent from Hull to Salesforce, so first configure a "Segment" as a user filter to control which users get sent to Salesforce as Leads.
Check connector documentation (Docs tab above) for more details about how Hull determines if a user is a Lead or Contact.

Then configure the attributes you want synchronized.

settings_sections.title: Users - Fetching Contacts from Salesforce
settings_sections.description: Hull gives it's customers the ability to capture a subset of Contacts fields in order to have fine grain control over the dataflow. Please configure the fields that you would like pulled from Salesforce below. See connector documentation (Docs tab above) for attributes mapping best practices.

settings_sections.title: Users - Sending Contacts to Salesforce
settings_sections.description:
Configuring this section will result in automated data flows which will create and update your Contacts in Salesforce. That's why we provide fine grain control over the updates that you send to Salesforce. By default no users are sent from Hull to Salesforce, so first configure a "Segment" as a user filter to control which users get sent to Salesforce as Contact.
Check connector documentation (Docs tab above) for more details about how Hull determines if a user is a Lead or Contact.

Then configure the attributes you want synchronized.

settings_sections.title: Accounts - Identity
settings_sections.description: **Identity** is one of the most important concepts in Hull. The field mapping for account identity should correspond to unique fields across systems. This identity applies to both the data we send to Salesforce as well as the data we pull from Salesforce. To read more about identity resolution please click [here](https://help.hull.io/hc/en-us/articles/360030051471).

settings_sections.title: Accounts - Fetching from Salesforce
settings_sections.description: Hull gives it's customers the ability to decide if to fetch any Accounts from Salesforce and select a subset of Accounts fields in order to have fine grain control over the dataflow. Please configure the fields that you would like pulled from Salesforce below.

settings_sections.title: Accounts - Sending to Salesforce
settings_sections.description:
Configuring this section will result in automated data flows which will create and update your Accounts in Salesforce. That's why we provide fine grain control over the updates that you send to Salesforce. First configure a "Segment" as an account filter to control which accounts get sent to Salesforce as Accounts. By default no accounts are sent from Hull to Salesforce.

Then configure the attributes you want synchronized.

settings_sections.title: Events - Fetching Tasks from Salesforce
settings_sections.description:
Hull gives it's customers the ability to decide if to fetch any Tasks from Salesforce.

- All standard attributes on the task will be fetched.

- If a Task was created via an event from Hull, that Task will not be fetched, neither on deletion nor update, given that the reference from the Salesforce Task to the Hull Event is not removed.

settings_sections.title: Events - Sending Events as Tasks to Salesforce
settings_sections.description:
Configure this section in order to send selected Hull User Events as Salesforce Tasks.

Review all fields here before toggling the traffic since there is a specific prerequsite for the setup:

- If an event is imported into Salesforce as a Task, the id of that event must be stored on a field of the Task to guarantee that the Hull Event and the Salesforce Task remain in sync.
- This field needs to be set up in your salesforce instance as a unique external id on the Task.
- If this field is not set, Hull will not send the event to Salesforce.
- If this field is ever removed, the task will be imported back into Hull as a separate and new event, given that 'Fetch Tasks' is turned on.

settings_sections.title: Advanced
settings_sections.description:
You can configure the Connector to connect to a specific Sandbox system. Before proceeding please read carefully "Connect with a Sandbox Environment" section in Docs available above.

When you are ready enter the login url of your Sandbox environment here and click “Save” to persist your changes. Switch to the tab "Overview" and click on "Credentials" to authenticate against your Sandbox system.
